result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan J Raikowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs.  
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 14CF151. 
May be eligible for discharge after 12 months, if agent recommends and once defendant completes conditions of supervision.

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED that the no-merit report is rejected and the appeal is dismissed without prejudice.  Atty Patricia Sommer or a successor appointed by the State Public Defender shall continue to represent Raikowski on these matters.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED tha the time for Raikowski to file a postconviction motion shall be extended until March 30, 2018.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published

records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order dismissing

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED that the no-merit report is rejected and the appeal is dimissed without prejudice.  Atty Patricia Sommer or a successor appointed by the State Public Defender shall continue to represent Raikowski on these matters.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED  that the time for Raikowski to file a post conviction motion shall be extended until March 30, 2018 and IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

IT IS ORDERED that the clerk of the circuit court shall disregard our prior order to supplement the record with the transcript of the September 10, 2015 plea hearing; IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that our order that counsel file a supplemental no-merit report addressing that plea hearing remains in effect

IT IS ORDERED that, within 10 days of the date of this order, the clerk of the circuit court shall transmit a supplement of the transcript from the plea hearing held on September 10, 2014, or promptly advise this court if there is an impediment in doing so; IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, within 20 days of the date of this order, counsel shall file a supplemental no-merit report addressing Raikowski's plea to the disorderly conduct charge, his motion to withdraw that plea, and the DNA Surcharge issue.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dylan J Raikowski in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CM-299, 15CF-261 and 14CF-151.

10:34 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Matters are set for a plea and sentencing today.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.
Atty Halverson has communicated all plea agreements with Defendant.
Atty Halverson is appearing on behalf of Atty Renc for today's hearing.
Atty Halverson has addressed potential immigration conditions with Defendant.

There is a plea agreement.
Atty Cousins addresses the Court regarding the plea agreement.

14CF-151: Has been resolved already by VIP
State requests that VIP to be revoked, enter judgment of conviction, find Defendant guilty of Count 2
Defendant did not comply with VIP

BY THE COURT:
Court will revoke plea and find Defendant GUILTY on Count 2 in 14CF-151 and order Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record

15CF-261:
State has filed an amended criminal complaint to misdemeanor bailjumping. Defendant will enter plea.

15CM-299:
File would be dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes

Atty Halverson concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.


Defendant enters a plea of: 
NO CONTEST Count 2 14CF-151
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1 15CF-261

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CF-151: Count 2 Misdemeanor Disorderly Conduct 
15CF-261: Misdemeanor Bailjumping 946.49(1)(a)
15CM-299: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
14CF-151:
Count 2:
Jail sentence for 30 days, imposed and stayed
Probation for a period of 18 Months
Conditions:
Pay costs
Submit to DNA sample and pay surcharge
Perform 10 hours of community service
Do not possess/consume any controlled substances except medications prescribed by a treating physician
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time
Continue with AODA counseling as counselor recommends
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent
May be eligible for early discharge after 12 months, if agent recommends and once Defendant completes conditions of supervision

15CF-261:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 30 days, imposes and stayed, Concurrent to 14CF-151
Probation for a period of 18 Months, Concurrent to 14CF-151
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 14CF-151
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
May be eligible for early discharge after 12 months, if agent recommends and once Defendant completes conditions of supervision
